events.message: The applicant submitted the loan application to cover unexpected medical expenses and some outstanding personal debts.
The loan application was reviewed and categorised under Personal Loan based on the applicant's intended use for medical and debt consolidation.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to the case to assist the applicant throughout the application and approval process.
The initial review included verifying the applicant's personal details, current employment status, and loan purpose.
Additional financial documents were requested, including recent pay stubs, medical bills, and bank statements to support the application.
The applicant promptly submitted all the requested documents, ensuring all medical invoices and proof of income were included.
Credit check was performed and showed a satisfactory credit score, although with some existing debts that matched the applicant's disclosed information.
Risk assessment was completed; the debt-to-income ratio was acceptable but the recent medical expenses elevated risk slightly.
An offer for the personal loan was presented with favorable interest rates considering the applicant’s medical situation and credit standing.
The applicant provided positive feedback on the loan offer and requested a few clarifications about repayment terms and fees.
The application was escalated to senior underwriting to review the applicant’s questions and confirm final loan terms.
Senior underwriting approved the loan, confirming that all conditions are met and the loan is ready to be funded.
The loan amount was successfully disbursed into the applicant's bank account, enabling payment of medical bills and debt consolidation.
Follow-up contact was made to ensure the applicant is satisfied with the loan and answer any questions about repayment schedules.
The loan application file was officially closed after confirming the funding and post-approval follow-up were successfully completed.
